name: MythBusters
description: Two special effects experts with over 30 years of experience set out to methodically bust three urban legends in each episode. They test theories to prove or disprove what is real and what is truly urban myth.

episodes.name: Jet Assisted Chevy
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam find out if a rocket attached to a '67 Chevy creates a 350-mile-per-hour road warrior and then test a stomach-exploding theory by combining fizzy candy with soda. It's sure to be a blast!

episodes.name: Biscuit Bazooka
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam investigate whether canned biscuits can become a bazooka and then test the strength of plate glass in a high-rise building. They also find out if it's possible to get stuck to an airline toilet.

episodes.name: Poppy Seed Drug Test
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam find out if poppy seeds can really affect a drug test and if balloons can lift a lawn chair into the air. Also, Jamie learns first-hand if being covered in gold paint is truly a glamorous way to die.

episodes.name: Explosive Decompression
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam find out if a single bullet hole can cause explosive decompression and destroy an aircraft. They also explore using a gun cartridge as a car ignition fuse and the possibility of ripping a car off its rear axle.

episodes.name: Barrel of Bricks
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam test how dangerous it is to urinate on a train track's electrified rail and if an eel-skin wallet can erase the magnetic information on credit cards. Also, they investigate the damage 500 pounds of bricks can do.

episodes.name: Penny Drop
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam investigate if a penny dropped from a skyscraper can kill a pedestrian and if a tanning bed can bake a body to death from the inside out. Also, they explore the idea of picking up radio signals in a tooth filling.

episodes.name: Exploding Toilet
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam investigate whether an assassin could use an ice bullet for an evidence-free crime and what it takes to make a toilet explode. They also determine once and for all if it's better to walk or run through the rain.

episodes.name: Breakstep Bridge
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam find out if the rhythm of marching soldiers can collapse a bridge and if a rowing team is strong enough to pull Jamie up on water skis. They also investigate how much bacteria from the toilet lands on a toothbrush.

episodes.name: Chicken Gun
episodes.description: The guys find out if a chicken launched at an airplane will disrupt flight and if a washing machine can be deadly. They also explore the myth of the woman who swallowed an octopus egg then gave birth to an eight-legged offspring.

episodes.name: Alcatraz Escape
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam retrace the steps of escaped Alcatraz prisoners and find out if it's possible to survive the San Francisco Bay in a homemade raft. Then they investigate mind control experiments and the echo of a duck's quack.

episodes.name: Lightning and Tongue Piercing
episodes.description: Jaime and Adam try to make a working cannon from a tree and then see if Adam's tongue piercing can withstand the force of a lightning bolt. Also, they put the Breathalyzer to the test.

episodes.name: Cellphone Destroys Gas Station
episodes.description: Jamie Hyneman and Adam Savage investigate how pressure affects silicone implants at high altitude and if using a cellphone at a gas station can have explosive results.

episodes.name: Buried in Concrete
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam try to dig up the truth on Jimmy Hoffa being allegedly buried in concrete under Giants Stadium. They also find out if a jet engine could launch a taxi 75 feet and if a daddy longlegs is the most venomous spider.

episodes.name: Buried Alive
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam investigate the chances of survival after being buried alive and jumping off a bridge if the water's surface has been broken. Also, they put cola myths to the test, from cleaning rust to cooking a steak.

episodes.name: Stinky Car
episodes.description: Jamie Hyneman and Adam Savage put their noses to the test to determine if that nasty smell in the car is there to stay and then they try to flush out the truth of the raccoon in the drain myth.

episodes.name: Sinking Titanic
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam explore the Titanic-sized myth of a sinking ship sucking passengers under as it goes down. Then they find out if goldfish remember anything for more than three seconds and what a lit firecracker does to a trombone.

episodes.name: Chinese Invasion Alarm
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie investigate an ancient Chinese subterranean sonar system that detected an invasion from below. Then they test related bacteria myths such as a dog's mouth is cleaner than a human's and the classic five-second rule.

episodes.name: Ming Dynasty Astronaut
episodes.description: Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman investigate the Ming dynasty astronaut myth by launching a dummy in the desert. Then they go on a quest for free energy while the MythBuster build team creates a killer ceiling fan.

episodes.name: Son of a Gun
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie find out how dangerous it is to use the phone or shower during a thunderstorm while Scottie and Kari recreate a boating myth. Then the whole crew takes on a story that involves a ricocheted bullet and a pregnancy.

episodes.name: Myths Revisited
episodes.description: Jamie Hyneman and Adam Savage revisit some controversial myths and put their own previous experiments to the test, including electric rails, exploding implants and cellphones at the gas pump.

episodes.name: Exploding Jawbreaker
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam find out if a regular playing card can be thrown fast enough to kill and if a heated jawbreaker can turn into an explosive situation. They also invent a static cannon to evaluate the truth of an urban legend.

episodes.name: MythBusters Revisited
episodes.description: Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman revisit some favorite myths to silence the critics. They take another shot at experiments with exploding soda in a hot car, running in the rain and getting blown away by gunfire.

episodes.name: Elevator of Death
episodes.description: Jamie Hyneman and Adam Savage attempt to save themselves in a falling elevator by jumping just before it hits bottom. Then they challenge their imaginations and building skills as they try to create a homemade levitation machine.

episodes.name: Ancient Death Ray
episodes.description: Jamie Hyneman and Adam Savage investigate the legend of Archimedes setting fire to a Roman fleet using only mirrors and sunlight. Then they try to remove the stink of a skunk and also test a direct hit on a bullet-proof shield.

episodes.name: Ping-Pong Rescue
episodes.description: Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman find out whether a sunken boat can be lifted using only Ping-Pong balls while Scottie, Tory and Kari get carried away investigating how many balloons it takes to lift a three-year-old off the ground.

episodes.name: Quicksand
episodes.description: Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman pull off an electrifying experiment with a hairdryer and a bathtub. Then they test the explosive relationship of tattoos and MRI machines before getting a sinking feeling in some killer quicksand.

episodes.name: Scuba Diver and Car Capers
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie find out if a scuba diver could be sucked out of the water by a helicopter and land in the middle of a forest fire. Also, from a banana in the tailpipe to sugar in the gas tank, movie motor myths are tested.

episodes.name: Killer Brace Position
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie investigate the myth that the brace position is designed to kill passengers in an airplane crash. Then Kari joins Adam at the track to find out if it's more dangerous to drive while talking on a cellphone or drunk.

episodes.name: Brown Note
episodes.description: Adam suits up in an adult diaper as he and Jamie test subsonic frequencies. Then they find out if Tory is blown away by a gunfight experiment, while Kari suffers under a constant drip of water.

episodes.name: Boom Lift Catapult
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie find out what it takes to turn a 30,000-pound boom lift into a medieval catapult. Then it's air conditioning vs. open windows as they investigate the most fuel-efficient way to keep cool in the car.

episodes.name: Bulletproof Water
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie find out exactly how deep one must dive to survive various types of gunshot. Then the crew joins forces in some playground pandemonium to see if a swing can make it 360 degrees, up and over the bar.

episodes.name: Exploding House
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie find out if a bug bomb mixed with toxic fumes proves to be an explosive combination then they compete to see who can build the better machine to find a needle in a haystack.  Meanwhile, Tory and Kari talk to plants.

episodes.name: Cooling a Six-Pack
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie rebuild a crash test dummy and give him a baptism of destruction, then they explore the fastest way to cool a six-pack of beer. Meanwhile, the crew investigates a crude form of battery that existed in ancient times.

episodes.name: Jet Pack
episodes.description: The sky is the limit as Adam and Jamie attempt to build a jetpack flying machine based on designs from the internet. Meanwhile, Tory, Kari and Scottie investigate the mystical energy myth of the pyramids.

episodes.name: Border Slingshot
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test the myth of a human-sized slingshot firing immigrants 200 yards over the border. The slingshot is rumored to be so accurate that it can safely land the human projectile on a carefully placed mattress.

episodes.name: Is Yawning Contagious?
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie find out if toast really does fall buttered side down while Kari, Scottie and Tory investigate if yawning is truly contagious. Then the whole team tests a toy car vs. a Dodge Viper in a gravity slope race.

episodes.name: Salsa Escape
episodes.description: Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman try to bust out of jail using only salsa and then team up with the FBI to test a massive number of explosives on a truck filled with hardened cement.

episodes.name: MythBusters Revealed
episodes.description: From Jamie's flubbed lines to Adam's remarkable talent for injury, the MythBusters reveal the funny moments, misadventures and mayhem that happen as they test the truth of modern myths.

episodes.name: Killer Tissue Box
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie find out if a box of tissues can turn deadly during a car crash, while Grant, Tory and Kari investigate a legend claiming Robin Hood could fire an arrow and split his opponent's arrow in two.

episodes.name: Breaking Glass
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie find out if a singing voice can really break glass while Tory takes on the challenge of building an explosive jet engine from vacuum parts. Then the crew explores the idea that a rolling stone gathers no moss.

episodes.name: Escape Slide Parachute
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test the parachute qualities of an airplane's escape slide then look into the story of a flight attendant who survived a crash still strapped in her seat. Meanwhile, the team tests an explosive hair cream myth.

episodes.name: Exploding Port-a-Potty
episodes.description: Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman investigate whether a broken drive shaft can cause a car to pole-vault from a pothole. Then they find out how explosive it can be to light a cigarette in a port-a-potty.

episodes.name: Beat the Radar Detector
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test radar-gun deflection methods like hanging a disco ball from the rearview mirror or using flat-black paint. They also investigate the myth of a man holding a piece of plywood being carried away by the wind.

episodes.name: Killer Whirlpool
episodes.description: With a little help from the Coast Guard, Adam and Jamie investigate the maritime myth of whirlpools powerful enough to swallow entire ships. Meanwhile, Grant, Tory and Kari find out if a snowplow can blow a car off the road.

episodes.name: More Myths Revisited
episodes.description: Adam, Jamie and the team return to some of the most controversial myths and answer the complaints of armchair MythBusters. The revisited myths include the salami rocket, ancient pottery acoustics and sword vs. gun barrel.

episodes.name: Steel Toe Amputation
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test steel toe boots to find out if a toe amputation myth has any footing. Then Tory, Grant and Kari build a soda bottle rocket pack and explore Newton's third law -- every action has an equal and opposite reaction.

episodes.name: Seasickness: Kill or Cure
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie hit the road to test the fuel efficiency of driving with the tailgate down on a truck. Then the whole team takes on the challenge of seasickness remedies and the life-saving myth of shoving a finger into a shotgun.

episodes.name: Confederate Rocket
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie investigate the Civil War myth of a Confederate Army long-range missile, rumored to have been launched from Richmond, Virginia, and aimed at The White House over 100 miles away.

episodes.name: Shattering Subwoofer
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie pump up the bass to find out if a stereo can be loud enough to destroy a car, while Grant, Tory and Kari test the theory that you get a smoother ride by driving faster over a rough road.

episodes.name: Exploding Lighter
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie turn up the heat to test the explosive nature of a disposable lighter near sparks or in a hot car. Meanwhile, Grant, Tory and Kari don their cowboy hats to try and shoot down some popular gunslinger myths.

episodes.name: Exploding Pants
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie investigate the theory that gas and car companies conspire to deliberately make cars that guzzle fuel. Meanwhile, Tory, Grant and Kari look into the myth of the spontaneous combustion of farmers' trousers.

episodes.name: Concrete Glider
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie delve into aerodynamics and construction in a competition to build a glider from concrete. Meanwhile, Grant, Tory and Kari find out just how dangerous it is to stand too close to the edge of a train platform.

episodes.name: Franklin's Kite
episodes.description: The team investigates electricity and flying a kite, following Ben Franklin's specifications, while Adam and Jamie tastefully test the two most requested flatulent myths.

episodes.name: 22,000 Foot Fall
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam test a myth that a man survived a 22,000-foot fall cushioned by an explosion. Meanwhile, the team finds out if it's energy efficient to leave a light on to avoid the surge in electricity from being turned off.

episodes.name: Firearms Folklore
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test three gun legends, including two bullets colliding midair in a Civil War battle. Then Grant, Tory and Kari look into the rumor that striking two hammers together results in a dangerous spray of steel shrapnel.

episodes.name: Deadly Straw
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie find out if hurricane winds can get strong enough to blow a piece of straw through a tree trunk or the feathers off a chicken. Meanwhile, Grant, Tory and Kari use a polygraph to find out if plants have feelings.

episodes.name: Shredded Plane
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie investigate the cause of a shredded airplane while Grant, Tory and Kari test their survival skills trying to start a fire without matches.

episodes.name: Hollywood on Trial
episodes.description: Adam, Jamie and the team explore movie myths and effects, from ricochet bullet sparks to crashing through a plate-glass window. They also take a look at big-screen myths from previous shows, like swimming in quicksand.

episodes.name: Crimes and Myth-demeanors 2
episodes.description: Adam, Jamie and the team test the latest in security technology, from thermal sensors to fingerprint scanners. Then the guys move on to something more explosive as they take safe-cracking to the next level.

episodes.name: Air Cylinder Rocket
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie find out if a compressed-air cylinder with a cracked valve can blast through a cinderblock wall. Meanwhile, Grant, Tory and Kari have a blast exploring if it's possible to get an engine running with gunpowder.

episodes.name: Mind Control
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie cook up a DIY nightmare as they mix paint and dynamite for a home improvement myth, while Grant, Tory and Kari find out if it's possible to manipulate someone's mind remotely. The mission is to remove Jamie's beret.

episodes.name: Antigravity Device
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test the flammability of Christmas tree lights, while Grant, Tory and Kari investigate the claims of several antigravity devices. Then Kari takes one more shot at the myth of vodka curing a jellyfish sting.

episodes.name: Earthquake Machine
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie build an earthquake machine following the method of Nikola Tesla and test it out on both a building and a bridge. Meanwhile, Grant, Tory and Kari investigate the story of a lava lamp exploding on top of a stove.

episodes.name: Killer Cable Snaps
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie explore the theory that if a high-tension cable snaps it can slice a person in two. Then, Grant, Tory and Kari investigate the myth that ancient pottery contains sounds from the past that can be heard today.

episodes.name: Paper Crossbow
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie explore a prison myth and try to make a deadly weapon with only newspaper and underwear. Then Grant, Kari and Tory hit the bottle to investigate more vodka myths.

episodes.name: Shop Till You Drop
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie reveal their favorite shopping locations for myth busting gear, from a tiny tongue stud to a gigantic boom lift. Then Adam gives a tour of his personal collection, including the weirdest object he owns.

episodes.name: Helium Football
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test a myth that helium-filled footballs fly farther and hang longer than regulation balls, while Grant, Tory and Kari investigate if teeth are strong enough to withstand the force of a bullet.

episodes.name: Confederate Steam Gun
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam take on a mythical confederate weapon: a steam-powered machine gun rumored to fire 400 rounds a minute at a 300-yard range. Meanwhile, the team puts their lying skills on the line to try to beat a lie detector.

episodes.name: Myth Revolution
episodes.description: Kari, Tory and Grant puts the latest covert surveillance conspiracy theories to the test. Meanwhile, Adam and Jamie are testing a myth about weapons.

episodes.name: Pirates 2!
episodes.description: In this piratical sequel, the MythBusters once again plunder and pillage for maritime myth, testing two Pirates of the Caribbean movie-inspired myths and the curse of a Sand Neck Tie.

episodes.name: Airplane Hour
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam take wing to test if a person with no flight training can safely land an airplane.  Tory, Grant, and Kari jump on some Hollywood-inspired skydiving myths.

episodes.name: Viewer Special
episodes.description: The Mythbusters have been putting out the call for new myths to bust and now, they put a new batch of viewer suggestions to the test.

episodes.name: Airplane on a Conveyor Belt
episodes.description: In this three-myth blockbuster, the team takes a crash course in remote-controlled airplane flying and bug out by testing the "cockroach survival" theory. They return to fraternity pranks with exploding cans of shaving cream.

episodes.name: Big Rig Myths
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie try to find out if an exploding truck tire can kill. Meanwhile, Kari, Tory and Grant investigate another fuel efficiency fable.

episodes.name: James Bond Special- Part 2
episodes.description: The Mythbusters dedicate this one-hour special to the ultimate action hero: James Bond. They put the gadgets and stunts to the test leaving them shaken, not stirred.

episodes.name: Shooting Fish in a Barrel
episodes.description: The MythBusters test the truth behind some time-honored sayings and conventional wisdom -- like shooting fish in a barrel, the best cure for a chile burn and whether or not elephants are really scared of mice.

episodes.name: MacGyver Myths
episodes.description: This reverential episode of MythBusters pays tribute to the man who made something really useful from out of almost anything-MacGyver!

episodes.name: James Bond Special- Part 1
episodes.description: t's tuxedos and martinis as the Mythbusters take on 007 in this James Bond special one-hour episode. Our stealthy secret agents are on a mission to explode the myths about Bond's gadgets, getaways and guns.

episodes.name: Speed Cameras
episodes.description: Take two self-confessed speed freaks, Adam and Jamie, and pit them against the people's nemesis: speed cameras. The result: an action-packed adventure full of fun, fascination and, best of all, fast cars.

episodes.name: Hindenburg Mystery
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie turn dirigible detectives to try and solve one of aeronautics biggest puzzles, while Kari, Tory and Grant come face-to-face with -- and have to flee from -- some of nature's natural-born killers.

episodes.name: Viewer Special 2
episodes.description: On the first Viewer's Special we tested a bunch of myths from the Mythbusters fan site, and it was a blast-literally.  So in our second Viewer's Special we once again open up Adam and Jamie's inbox for ideas.

episodes.name: Exploding Water Heater
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam get steamed testing if a water heater can rocket through the roof and into the atmosphere. Meanwhile, Tory, Grant and Kari try on some all-American myths about blue jeans.

episodes.name: Superhero Hour
episodes.description: The Mythbusters are wearing their underpants on the outside, as the Marvel comic maestros are put under the MythBusters microscope.

episodes.name: Walking on Water
episodes.description: Adam, Jamie and a ninjitsu master try their luck at aquatic agility and get confrontational while competing to see how ninjas -- masters of illusion-- create the impression of running on water.

episodes.name: Trail Blazers
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie get on the trail of some flammable Hollywood fables while Kari, Grant and Tory break out the defibrillator for some electrifying action.

episodes.name: Lead Balloon
episodes.description: Surf's up dude! The team tests whether a couple of sticks of dynamite can create ideal surfing conditions and then test the proverbial lead balloon.

episodes.name: Pirate Special
episodes.description: Arggghhh me hearties -- Jamie and Adam have plundered the seven seas in search of pirate parables and maritime myths. They investigate four stories of hi-jinks on the high seas, and the action is thick and fast.

episodes.name: Grenades and Guts
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam investigate the cliche that a quick-thinking action hero can protect his fellow cast members from a grenade blast. Meanwhile, the intrepid trio tests an Internet video with an outrageous claim about soda and candy.

episodes.name: Voice Flame Extinguisher
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam set out to discover if it's possible to put out a fire using only your voice. Meanwhile, Kari, Tory and Grant will put four classic hypnosis hypotheses under the microscope.

episodes.name: Birds in a Truck
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie tackle Newton, the founder of the principle of thermodynamics and the law of conservation of momentum. They look into a physics urban myth and try to determine if birds in a truck lighten the load take flight

episodes.name: Baseball Myths
episodes.description: Roger Clemens, perhaps baseball's greatest living pitcher, joins the gang to take on the national pastime as only the Mythbusters can.

episodes.name: Red Rag to a Bull
episodes.description: The team tests the legend that the color red can drive a bull toward psychopathy. Fresh from bull jousting, the team tests the saying "bull in a china shop."

episodes.name: Western Myths
episodes.description: It's Yeehaa and Hiyo Silver as Adam and Jamie saddle up for some western myths -- and that is not all. Kari, Tory, and Grant test the modern marvel of airbags. It's all here -- past, present, horses, cars and guns.

episodes.name: Dog Myths
episodes.description: Is it possible to teach an old dog new tricks? To find an answer, Adam and Jamie work with a pair of untrained, middle-aged malamute huskies. Meanwhile, Kari, Grant and Tory look into different myths on how to beat a guard dog.

episodes.name: Snow Special
episodes.description: In this episode of Mythbusters, the whole team is piste off and that's snow joke. They are snowed under with movie myths and living legends as they put snow myths to the test in this Snow Special.

episodes.name: Holiday Special
episodes.description: The MythBusters team investigates whether reindeer really could help Santa fly, what's the best way to keep all the needles on your Christmas tree and how much yodeling it actually takes to start an avalanche.

episodes.name: More Myths Reopened
episodes.description: Every so often, the MythBusters draw conclusions that leave the fans seething. Well, once again, it's time for the MythBusters to put some of their most contentious outcomes under the microscope.

episodes.name: Underwater Car
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam test the stuff of nightmares trying to escape from underwater cars. Meanwhile Grant, Tory and Kari roll out the Seven Paper Fold myth. Is it possible to fold a piece of paper in half more than seven times?

episodes.name: Water Stun Gun
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam set out to see if they can turn a conventional electric stun gun into a water-powered electric stun gun. Meanwhile, Kari, Tory and Grant are playing with fire, literally.

episodes.name: Coffin Punch
episodes.description: The whole team gets together to test myths about survival, including what constitutes bulletproof and whether it's possible to escape once buried alive.

episodes.name: Blind Driving
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie investigate whether it's possible for a blind person to drive, whether trees are 90 percent air, whether metal cleats attract lightning and what sort of explosion might help a stroke count.

episodes.name: Viral Hour
episodes.description: Viral videos get a timely checkup as Jamie and Adam try to blast a full-sized car with fire hoses and to float a tinfoil boat in an empty fish tank, while Tory, Kari and Grant investigate the mystery of the fainting goats.

episodes.name: NASA Moon Landing
episodes.description: The team tackles the tallest tale of all in Moon Landing Hoax Hour. They investigate whether or not NASA pulled off the greatest cover-up in human history.

episodes.name: Exploding Steak
episodes.description: The team test two fan-suggested myths -- if meat can be tenderized with explosives and the if driving angry can burn fuel. We push the limits of what people are willing to try, and what they simply can't avoid.

episodes.name: Viewer Special Threequel
episodes.description: In this viewer special sequel, sequel, the team tackles four of their favorites including a gruesome myth from World War II, a cure for hypothermia, exploding toilets and musical mushroom clouds.

episodes.name: Phone Book Friction
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie set out to discover whether it is really impossible to tear apart two interwoven phone books. Meanwhile, Kari, Grant and Tory test a fishy tale of Hollywood pyrotechnics with their own big bang theories.

episodes.name: Alaska Special
episodes.description: Alaska is one of the most extreme places on earth. For the Mythbusters, it provides an ideal habitat to test some Alaskan anecdotes.

episodes.name: Motorcycle Flip
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie take on an Indiana Jones movie stunt, while Kari, Grant and Troy try to break out of jail using ropes made of nothing but bed sheets, hair and toilet paper.

episodes.name: End With a Bang
episodes.description: The team joins forces, placing popular sayings under the microscope to determine whether it really is "impossible to polish a turd," possible to "hit the ground running" or advisable to "end with a bang."

episodes.name: Ninjas 2
episodes.description: In this special, Jamie and Adam revisit some old ninja myths and tackle some new ones. And the world's foremost arrow-catching ninja, Anthony Kelly, will settle the dispute of whether it's possible to catch an arrow midair.

episodes.name: Alcohol Myths
episodes.description: Half the team sets out to test the phenomenon of "beer goggles," as well as various sobering up techniques, such as running on a treadmill and face slapping, while the other half investigates a legendary medieval Korean weapon.

episodes.name: Unarmed and Unharmed
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie return to the old wild west for a quick draw gun-slinging story. Then, Grant, Tory and Jessi attempt to recreate the iconic scene from the movie Speed.

episodes.name: Antacid Jail Break
episodes.description: The team explores how prisoners use antacid tablets as explosion.  Then, Grant, Jessi and Tory discover how modern day smugglers successfully cross borders in dark, remote locations.

episodes.name: Curving Bullets
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie are challenged when they try to create a shock wave with glass shattering capabilities. Then Adam creates a sonic boom and Kari, Grant and Tory attempt to bend bullets.

episodes.name: Dumpster Diving
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test whether diving into a dumpster is a valid way to get off a roof quickly. Meanwhile Kari, Grant and Tory take on an deep-sea diving myth.

episodes.name: Dirty vs. Clean Car
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie get down and dirty with the myth that a muddy motorcar gets better gas mileage than it's clean cousin. Later, the team is hitting the sauce and comparing hangovers to test an age old adage about beer and liquor.

episodes.name: Duct Tape Hour
episodes.description: The team explores the capabilities of duct tape, from lifting a car to repairing boats. Kari, Grant and Tory experiment with ballistics and joins the forces between duct tape and PVC cement.

episodes.name: Knock Your Socks Off
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie experiment with the Bullet Dropped vs. Bullet Fire Theory. Then Kari, Grant and Tory  put a test dummy in a boxing ring to see if they can knock its socks off, and the team comes together to play with explosives.

episodes.name: Myth Evolution
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie experiment with water heaters in the household. Then, they hold on for dear life and test out whether one could survive holding on to a moving car. Later, they discover whether or not a car can be split in half.

episodes.name: Crash and Burn
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test a classic myth that's been around in tinsel-town since the motorcar was invented: does an out-of-control car really crash and burn every time? Kari, Tory and Grant test a story about the first rocketeer.

episodes.name: Hurricane Windows
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie attempt to determine whether having windows opened or closed is key to survival during a hurricane. Meanwhile, Kari, Grant and Tory experiment with liquid nitrogen and investigate the myth behind "Frozen Tree".

episodes.name: Greased Lightning
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie are determined to create potential kitchen catastrophes by replicating a 30-foot fireball. Then, Kari, Tory and Grant wire a C4 to determine whether it can cause major damage to a convince store's microwave.

episodes.name: Demolition Derby Special
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test the physics behind an iconic motor movie. Then, they are determined to find answer behind how a compact car was sandwiched between two trucks. Later, they discover the truth behind a popular car commercial.

episodes.name: Alaska Special 2
episodes.description: In Alaska, the team recreates Pykrete, a composite material known for being bullet proof and tougher than concrete. They put their heads together to discover whether or not its defensive properties are in fact a myth.

episodes.name: Banana Slip, Double Dip
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie take two classic comedy myths, the banana peel slip and the germy double dip.  Meanwhile, Kari, Grant and Tory try to make homemade diamonds and get the biggest bang in MythBuster history.

episodes.name: YouTube Special
episodes.description: On this all-viral episode, the team puts the most requested YouTube myths to the test, sizing up a web-hit about a giant ball of Legos and discover the explosive power of match heads.

episodes.name: Thermite vs. Ice
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie reveal the exciting reaction that happens as they experiment with Thermite. Then. Kari, Tory and Grant put their stereo's bass to the test and Adam and Jamie return to demonstrate the heat behind a powerful handgun.

episodes.name: Prison Escape
episodes.description: The crew is challenged when they set out to determine whether a person can survive car stunts performed in action movies, then they try and solve more outlandish jailbreak myths.

episodes.name: Seesaw Saga
episodes.description: The team works together to design, build and test out a giant seesaw. As the plan is in action, they are determined to tackle this massive and improbable myth.

episodes.name: Car vs. Rain
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie take on the classic urban myth about driving in the rain that says if you're out for a spin in your convertible and it starts raining you can stay dry by simply driving faster.

episodes.name: Boomerang Bullet
episodes.description: Grant, Tory and Jessi test the elastic properties of real trees as they were used to catapult diseased bodies during medieval Europe. Then, they confirm if a bullet can bounce off three steel surfaces and injure the enemy.

episodes.name: Hidden Nasties
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie turn dirt detectives to get to the bottom of two frighteningly filthy myths, while Tory, Grant and Jessi head to a lake to debunk a famous maniac movie myth.

episodes.name: Mini Myth Mayhem
episodes.description: The duo engrave a coconut and attempt to send it through the mail. Then, they attempt to light a match with a bullet. Later, they try and debunk the myth of ways that induce bed-wetting and the rest of the team makes earwax.

episodes.name: Swimming in Syrup
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam don their swimsuits to see if it really is possible to swim the same speed whether in syrup or water.

episodes.name: Exploding Bumper
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie lurch from one small disaster to another as they find a myth that tests their skills, and ends with a spectacle that graphically proves that you have every reason to be very, very afraid of your hatchback.

episodes.name: No Pain, No Gain
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie become lab rats for science and test the myth that some types of people are more tolerant to pain than others. Kari, Grant and Tory attempt to launch a backyard propane tank like a rocket.

episodes.name: Mythssion Control
episodes.description: The MythBusters revisit two myths armed with fan feedback and suggestions. First up, it's Hyneman vs. Newton and a cacophony of car carnage. Then Kari, Grant and Tory retest knock your socks off.

episodes.name: Spy Car Escape
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie investigate the perfect car weaponry of tacks, smoke and oil, all launched from the trunk of a vehicle. Then,  Kari, Grant and Tory attempt to debunk the myth of a fascinating physics "thought experiment".

episodes.name: Duct Tape Hour 2
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie set up a challenge that will take duct tape's strength, adhesion and load-bearing capability to the absolute limit. Meanwhile, Kari, Grant and Tory are all wrapped up busting duct tape automotive myths.

episodes.name: Dive to Survive
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie explore the myth of the classic stunt "dive to survive". Then, they experiment with the big bang theory and head to a lake with bomb shields and dynamite, and discover if phone books are bulletproof.

episodes.name: Flu Fiction
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie get grossed out as they investigate colds, flu, sneezing and contamination. Meanwhile, Kari, Tory and Grant take on the myth that tornadoes can transform everyday items into lethal projectiles.

episodes.name: Soda Cup Killer
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test the strength of power a Styrofoam cup filled with soda has against a car windshield.  Then, Tory, Grant and Jessi replicate the scene from Fall Guys and investigate if they can hang on by their fingertips.

episodes.name: MythBusters: Top 25 Moments
episodes.description: Adam, Jamie, Kari, Tory and Grant get nostalgic with a look back at their top 25 most-celebrated MythBusters moments.

episodes.name: Fireball Stun Gun
episodes.description: The whole team gets hot under the collar of what is no doubt a pyromaniac's dream. While Adam and Jamie literally play with fire, Kari, Grant and Tory get into some fireworks.

episodes.name: Waterslide Wipeout
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie tackle the biggest, dirtiest and most vertigo-inducing build in MythBusters history while Kari, Tory and Grant deliver the goods to find out if taking only right turns can save gas.

episodes.name: Bottle Bash
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie get feisty with a bar fight fable while Kari, Grant and Tory investigate a ballistic material mystery from history.

episodes.name: Inverted Underwater Car
episodes.description: Jamie bravely risks Adam's life to revisit one of the most spectacular, harrowing and successful myths in MythBusters history. Then Tory, Grant and Kari tackle a movie myth involving milk and a room full of methane.

episodes.name: President's Challenge
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie tackle a special request from the highest ranking viewer: President of the United States, Barack Obama.

episodes.name: Cold Feet
episodes.description: When you get cold feet, do you really get cold feet? When the poop hits the fan, does everyone get covered in the ensuing chaos?

episodes.name: Green Hornet Special
episodes.description: Seth Rogen, star and writer of the superhero blockbuster "The Green Hornet," joins the team for two blockbusting stories.

episodes.name: Bug Special
episodes.description: It's revenge of the creepy crawlies as the team tests if bees can lift a laptop, if water repels flies and if hitting a bug while riding a motorcycle can be deadly.

episodes.name: Reverse Engineering
episodes.description: Jaime and Adam are putting the pedal to the metal -- backwards. Then Kari, Grant and Tory turf some surfboards with a little help from an SUV.

episodes.name: Storm-Chasing Myths
episodes.description: It's a perfect storm as Reed Timmer and Sean Casey of Storm Chasers join Adam and Jamie to put tornadoes to the test.

episodes.name: Tablecloth Chaos
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie take on the traditional magic trick of the tablecloth whip, but with a supercharged twist. Kari, Grant and Tory strain their brains and call in neuroscientists to help them test a pop culture myth.

episodes.name: Mini Myth Madness
episodes.description: The team selects six mini myths from viewers. Adam and Jamie test a Hollywood costume cliche and take candy from a baby. Kari, Grant and Tory investigate bulletproof household objects and the fuel efficiency of overinflated tires.

episodes.name: Operation Valkyrie
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test the merits of a famous assassination attempt while Kari, Grant and Tory face the pain to see if you really can 'slap some sense' into someone.

episodes.name: Arrow Machine Gun
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie are on an archery odyssey, but there's no rest for Kari, Grant and Tory as they take a ride on the wild side for a dangerous driving myth.

episodes.name: Hair of the Dog
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie revisit the myth that an escaped convict can outsmart and outrun his pursuers. Kari, Grant and Tory do their best to bamboozle sniffer dogs that are specifically trained to find a particular substance.

episodes.name: Running on Water
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test if they can walk on water, and Kari, Grant and Tory test if common things can be bombproof.

episodes.name: Fixing a Flat
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test what it would take to fix a flat tire when you don't have a spare. Then, Kari, Grant, and Tory find out if a fishing reel can really catch fire if you hook a fast fish.

episodes.name: Mission Impossible Mask
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie face-off with a myth of misdirection, and Kari, Grant and Tory go ballistic with two firearm fables from films.

episodes.name: Blue Ice
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie tackle an explosive movie myth about magazines and toasters, and Kari, Grant and Tory take to the skies to investigate the mystery of the destructive blue ice.

episodes.name: Paper Armor
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie are exploring the physics of shock waves in water and how to avoid injury.  Kari, Grant, and Tory find out if battle armor made of paper can compare to steel.

episodes.name: Torpedo-Tastic
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie build an ancient torpedo to find out if it can strike a boat at 800 feet. Meanwhile, Kari, Grant and Tory test whether a truck full of wine can become a machine gun-like spectacle.

episodes.name: Let There Be Light
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam test a Hollywood lighting myth, while Kari, Grant and Tory go gangbusters trying to stop out of control cars.

episodes.name: Dodge a Bullet
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test if you can jump out of the way of a bullet, while the rest of the team has Buster jumping from great heights to find out if hitting the water is just like hitting pavement.

episodes.name: Spy Car 2
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie put some spy car gadgetry under the microscope while the rest of the team tests the veracity of a viral video about bullets on ice.

episodes.name: Bubble Trouble
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test a tall tale that claims it's impossible to stay afloat in bubbly water. Kari, Tory and Grant find out if an arrow packed with explosives can split a tree in two.

episodes.name: Blow Your Own Sail
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie put Hollywood sound effects up against reality, and Kari, Grant and Tory find out if it's possible to propel a sailboat with a fan.

episodes.name: Flying Guillotine
episodes.description: Jamie and Adam tackle a military myth that it's safe to use the explosive C4 as a cooking fuel.

episodes.name: Location, Location, Location!
episodes.description: From Alameda to Africa and from the desert to the deep blue sea, the MythBusters declassify their top destinations.

episodes.name: Newton's Crane Cradle
episodes.description: The experts are swinging for science - testing a viral video that supersizes Newton's cradle using wrecking balls to transfer energy.

episodes.name: Drain Disaster
episodes.description: The experts go underground to test if filling a sewer drain full of combustible gas would turn a manhole cover into a missile.

episodes.name: Walk a Straight Line
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test if blindfolded humans can travel in a straight line. Then, the team sees if binary explosives would explode in a fender bender.

episodes.name: Bikes and Bazookas
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test the myth that a motorcycle is a greener and cleaner machine than a car, while the team unleashes the first RPG in the show's history.

episodes.name: Toilet Bomb
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie tackle a blockbuster bathroom bomb, while Kari, Tory, and Grant take to the skies to find out if a flying V works for planes as well as it does for birds.

episodes.name: Wheel of Mythfortune
episodes.description: To determine the lucky winners of the viewer request lottery the guys spin the Wheel of Mythfortune and pick 5 random emails and letters and respond the only way they know how - with science.

episodes.name: Duct Tape Plane
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test three viral videos featuring extraordinary excavators to see if they can be used to row a barge, go wakeboarding or perform elaborate acrobatics.

episodes.name: Wet and Wild
episodes.description: The MythBusters never shy of putting their bodies on the line when it comes to H2O and now they're reliving their 12 wettest myths of all time.

episodes.name: Battle of the Sexes
episodes.description: The experts pit Men against Women in the ultimate Battle of the Sexes. Get set for all out war as the team tests five age-old gender-based clichés.

episodes.name: Bouncing Bullet
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie take aim at a ricochet myth from the TV show 'Burn Notice,' while Kari, Tory and Grant test the Hollywood myth that if you jump when running away from an explosion - can you surf the shock wave?

episodes.name: Mailbag Special
episodes.description: The MythBusters do a fan correspondence catch-up answering questions and taking mini myth requests - testing if you can eat a spoonful of cinnamon without drinking water and revealing how the camera crew captures explosions.

episodes.name: Square Wheels
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie reinvent the wheel, while Kari, Tory and Grant hit the breaks for a date night movie myth.

episodes.name: Swinging Pirates
episodes.description: The Hyneman and Captain Redbeard take a swing at a pirate movie myth while Kari, Tory and Grant roll out the barrel for a turbo charged go-cart.

episodes.name: Bubble Pack Plunge
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test if you can survive a jump from a building wrapped in bubble packaging while Kari, Grant, and Tory experiment with a James Bond ejector seat.

episodes.name: Driving in Heels
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie hit the highway with some fancy footwear, while Tory, Grant and Kari get stuck on glue.

episodes.name: Duct Tape Island
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie are abandoned on a deserted island with nothing but duct tape between them and disaster.

episodes.name: Revenge of the Myth
episodes.description: The whole team gets together to take fan favorites to another level in this experimental ramp-up.

episodes.name: Hollywood Gunslingers
episodes.description: The MythBusters bust out guns blazing to take aim at eight Hollywood firearms fables including never ending ammo, lethal nail guns and deadly silver bullets.

episodes.name: Fire vs. Ice
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie tackle an internet sensation about an epic duel between a flamethrower and a CO2 fire extinguisher, while Kari, Grant and Tory test if you can blind a spy drone with a dust cloud.

episodes.name: Duel Dilemmas
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test the dueling myth of bringing a knife to a gunfight while Kari, Grant, and Tory find out if a two-stage missile known as the fire breathing dragon ever really existed.

episodes.name: Mini Myth Medley
episodes.description: The team mixes it up with a medley of viewer requested myths and hit a home run with baseball legend Matt Cain. The guys test an underwater bike ride, if you really can 'know it like the back of your hand,' and the potty dance.

episodes.name: Hail Hijinx
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie pick apart some rope bridge physics from the action movie Cliffhanger while Kari, Grant and Tory test if giant hail can really sink a fishing boat by puncturing the hull.

episodes.name: Fright Night
episodes.description: There's thrills, spills, and spine tingling chills as Adam and Jamie see if certain sound frequencies can convince people of paranormal activity. Kari, Grant and Tory find out if the smell of fear really exists.

episodes.name: Food Fables
episodes.description: The team experiments with celebrity chef Alton Brown to find out if you can cook lasagna in a dishwasher and a meal under the hood of a car. Kari, Grant and Tory test tryptophan and what really tastes like chicken.

episodes.name: Cannonball Chemistry
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test whether a mattress can really cushion a watery wipeout. Meanwhile, Kari, Tory and Grant tackle a blast from the past as they test if cannonballs made of stone can really cause carnage.

episodes.name: Titanic Survival
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie team up with Titanic movie director James Cameron to tackle the most requested myth in MythBuster history while Kari, Grant and Tory ride a rocket-powered surfboard.

episodes.name: Explosions A to Z
episodes.description: Arguably the most perfect episode in MythBusters history, the team runs through the explosive alphabet highlighting some of the show's 752 detonations and counting.

episodes.name: Trench Torpedo
episodes.description: The guys fire up a myth from World War One - testing if a trench corner can slow down a shock wave and save a soldier. Tory, Kari and Grant crash clown cars to see if balloons can protect you in a crash.

episodes.name: Down and Dirty
episodes.description: The MythBusters get down and dirty to see if hand dryers are better than paper towels in public restrooms and seeing if it's really better to stand in the doorway during an earthquake.

episodes.name: Indy Car Special
episodes.description: The team burns rubber at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway and tests racing myths. Can man beat machine in a 30-foot, standing-start sprint? Can a driver lose 10 lbs during a race?

episodes.name: Motorcycle Water Ski
episodes.description: Jamie tests the myth that a motorcycle traveling at highway speeds can drive across the surface of a lake while the others see whether you can survive a jump from a high-rise with a parachute made from a hotel room's contents.

episodes.name: Battle of the Sexes - Round 2
episodes.description: It's Round 2 of Battle of the Sexes and the team tests the cliches: Will lost men really not stop and ask for directions? Are women better multitaskers? And should "throwing like a girl" really be an insult?

episodes.name: Breaking Bad Special
episodes.description: Things get volatile when the team meets "Breaking Bad" creator Vince Gilligan and star Aaron Paul to check the chemistry behind the hit TV show. The team recreates two iconic scenes to see if the science truly holds up.

episodes.name: Duct Tape Canyon
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie survive the desert, repel down canyon cliff-faces and brave class-5 rapids armed only with duct tape and bubble wrap.

episodes.name: Zombie Special
episodes.description: Michael Rooker joins the team to test if an ax or gun is more effective against zombies. Later, Adam turns undead to test if the "might of the living dead" can bust down Jamie's door.

episodes.name: Deadliest Catch Special
episodes.description: Deadliest Catch captains Johnathan and Junior join the team to test if a crab pot will drag you overboard if your foot is caught in a coil, if it's better to work 30 hours with no sleep, and if crab pots are indestructible.

episodes.name: Hypermiling/Crash Cushions
episodes.description: Could a guy sandwiched between two big guys in the backseat of a car survive being T-boned by a truck? The team also hits the road to test hypermiling myths and if these techniques really double your car's fuel efficiency.

episodes.name: Painting with Explosives
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie test two different ways to paint a room with a broom and the cursed, bifurcated boat myth returns to see if it can be split in two by a channel marker.

episodes.name: Mythssion Impossible
episodes.description: The MythBusters test three impossible idioms: Can you herd cats? Can you catch a greased pig? And can you cram 10 pounds of poop into a five-pound bag?

episodes.name: Supersonic Ping Pong
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie ask if a ping pong ball could be launched to supersonic speeds and become lethal. Kari, Grant and Tory test a Russian myth where an army laid siege using cannons and cannon balls made of ice!

episodes.name: Moonshine Myths
episodes.description: The MythBusters find out if an exploding moonshine still really could blow a house down and hooch could really be used as fuel for an unmodified car on a "moonshine run."

episodes.name: Do Try This at Home
episodes.description: After more than 10 years of testing impossible, dangerous and downright crazy myths that you shouldn’t or couldn’t try at home, the MythBusters investigate a host of myths that maybe you can!

episodes.name: Car Chase Chaos/Animal Antics
episodes.description: The guys test car chase movie cliches and if it's possible to change places or dump the driver while moving at speed. Also, the team tests some fan-suggested deterrents for driving away cats, bears, and snakes.

episodes.name: Star Wars: Revenge of the Myth
episodes.description: The MythBusters head to a galaxy far, far away to test Star-Wars-related myths including Luke's ability to swing himself and Leia across a chasm with his belt-rigged grappling hook and if an Ewok log could crush a Chicken Walker.

episodes.name: Bullet Baloney
episodes.description: The MythBusters attempt to fire a bent-barreled shotgun, shoot a gun in space, drop a gun in a deep fryer and more to test five filmic firearm cliches.

episodes.name: Hollywood Car Crash Cliches
episodes.description: It’s wall-to-wall automotive mayhem as the MythBusters drive through glass, plough through traffic and fire an RPG at an SUV to take aim at classic Hollywood crash cliches.

episodes.name: Household Disasters
episodes.description: The MythBusters test a variety of household myths that say a vacuum cleaner will explode while sucking up black powder and that sunscreen can scorch your skin.

episodes.name: Laws of Attraction
episodes.description: The MythBusters use sexy science to tackle five captivating cliches about the laws of attraction including if men really do prefer blondes and if a man's wealth can really woo women.

episodes.name: Fire in the Hole
episodes.description: Live grenades and TNT are used as the MythBusters dig into some of Hollywood's greatest explosive scenarios.

episodes.name: Traffic Tricks
episodes.description: The team tackles car and traffic myths: if a roundabout is better than a 4-way stop sign, if it's faster to drive than fly when your trip is under 400 miles, and if it's better to change lanes or stay put in heavy traffic.

episodes.name: Road Rage
episodes.description: The MythBusters test three car crimes straight from Hollywood: the cliff top push, the two-wheel wipeout and finally the Corvette barrel roll from "Wanted."

episodes.name: Plane Boarding/Bite the Bullet
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie discover the best, most efficient way to board an airplane while Tory, Kari, and Grant find out if a bullet made of teeth or even bone is non-traceable.

episodes.name: The Busters of the Lost Myths
episodes.description: Hold onto your iconic hats as Adam and Jamie put the legendary Indiana Jones and his hijinks to the test.

episodes.name: San Francisco Drift
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie are the fast and the curious. With the pedal firmly to the metal and their tires sliding and smoking they tackle two tall tales from the world of street racing.

episodes.name: Transformers
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie tackle two tall tales of mechanical metamorphosis, which sees them try to turn a car into a motorcycle and a bicycle into a boat.

episodes.name: The A-team Special
episodes.description: Adam "Hannibal" Savage and "Howlin' Mad" Hyneman put The A-Team under the MythBusters microscope.

episodes.name: Video Games Special
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie take mythbusting to the next level challenging the science of the virtual world rendered in video games -- it’s game over for false physics.

episodes.name: The Simpsons Special
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie are tackling the greatest animated TV series of all time. Along for the ride is special guest Al Jean, executive producer and show runner of iconic show, The Simpsons.

episodes.name: Blow It Out The Water
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie blow up a boat with 1,000 lb of high explosive before building a homemade machine gun from Breaking Bad’s season finale.

episodes.name: Supernatural Shooters
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie take aim at Hollywood’s infallible hit men and their seemingly supernatural ability to take down a target.

episodes.name: Dangerous Driving
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie crank the controversy to the max as they find out if hands-free driving is really the solution to making that all important call at the wheel.

episodes.name: Accidental Ammo
episodes.description: Stand by for some ballistic backyard bedlam and a gruesome glass guillotine in an episode devoted to accidental ammo.

episodes.name: Star Wars - Myths Strike Back
episodes.description: The Myths Strike Back when Adam and Jamie once again confront the dark side of science in a workshop not so far, far away.

episodes.name: Flights of Fantasy
episodes.description: Stow your tray tables because in this aviation extravaganza Adam and Jamie tackle two flights of fantasy that sees a MythBuster launched to the edge of space.

episodes.name: Unfinished Business
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie tackle four fan favorites from video games to grenades, from spy cars to super-fast firearms, the MythBusters are having a blast.

episodes.name: MythBusters vs. Jaws
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie revisit the Jaws explosive finale with a giant anatomically accurate shark and then take on two of the latest mythical shark repellents. They're going to need a bigger boat!

episodes.name: Cooking Chaos
episodes.description: In their farewell season the guys stir up some cooking chaos. Testing two viral video sensations -- cannon fired shrimp and an explosive tomato smoothie.

episodes.name: Driven to Destruction
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie destroy cars in style -- one with a vacuum cleaner and the other with a massive amount of C4!

episodes.name: Tanker Crush
episodes.description: In their farewell season Adam and Jamie take on their biggest ever experiment ever in an attempt to crush a giant tanker train car by creating a vacuum.

episodes.name: The Explosion Special
episodes.description: In their farewell season Adam and Jamie go out with a bang. They bid farewell to their favorite pastime with two explosive tall tales.

episodes.name: MythBusters: The Reunion
episodes.description: All five MythBusters reunite as they pull back the curtain as never before to give a suitably epic, enlightening and emotional finale to the best science show on television.

episodes.name: The Reddit Special
episodes.description: From the very beginning, fan feedback has been integral to MythBusters. Here, the most interactive show on TV dives into a reddit special, where the internet is in complete control of the editorial.

episodes.name: Failure is Not an Option
episodes.description: It’s the last ever Myths Revisited as the guys drift on dirt, fire at fish tanks and blow crap up, all in the name of science.

episodes.name: Volunteer Special
episodes.description: The MythBusters Volunteer Special tackles a myth about zombie weapons and how best to wait in line at a store. An army of human guinea pigs/volunteers help out.

episodes.name: MythBusters Revealed
episodes.description: In this behind-the-scenes exclusive, Adam and Jamie showcase what's to come in the mother of all seasons, and how they made it!

episodes.name: The MythBusters Grand Finale
episodes.description: Since 2002, Adam and Jamie have used science to separate fact from fiction in spectacular style. This is it. Prepare to be blown away by the most epic grand finale in television history!

episodes.name: Rocketmen
episodes.description: In their farewell season Adam and Jamie test the fan favorite, explosive technology, in a one mega-myth in-depth episode -- are gummy bears a viable rocket fuel?

episodes.name: Duct Tape: The Return
episodes.description: In the MythBusters final season farewell, they build a trebuchet and attempt to save Buster’s life with their favorite mechanical cure all -- duct tape.

episodes.name: Spike in the Road
episodes.description: The MythBusters test ways to beat police road spikes using DIY ingenuity and Hollywood driving skills. Then, they investigate if a high-powered fountain can actually lift and suspend a human.

episodes.name: Chimney Cannon
episodes.description: The MythBusters investigate if a burglar can be shot out of a chimney when the fireplace is lit. Then, they power up a chainsaw to test if a bullet embedded in a tree will have fatal consequences.

episodes.name: Wild Wild West
episodes.description: The MythBusters investigate two tall tales from the Wild West: how deadly a dynamite-firing crossbow is, and the best way to shoot from the hip during a shootout.

episodes.name: Fire Arrow vs. Gas Tank
episodes.description: The MythBusters investigate two arrow-themed myths: if a flaming arrow fired into a car's gas tank will cause it to explode, and if a deadly-looking tribal initiation is as dangerous as it seems.

episodes.name: Invisible Assassins
episodes.description: The MythBusters take on Hollywood's greatest invisible assassins with a trio of tall tales of ingenious booby traps.

episodes.name: Dynamite Deposit
episodes.description: The MythBusters investigate if it's possible to blow a safe open and not destroy the loot inside, and they look into whether dog owners really look like their pets.

episodes.name: Dead Body Double
episodes.description: The MythBusters tackle two explosive ballistic mysteries: if a dead body is bullet-proof and if a strange non-Newtonian fluid called oobleck is bomb-proof.

episodes.name: Heads Will Roll
episodes.description: The MythBusters put an exploding airbag to the ultimate test and tackle an epic movie myth using a rocket-powered sword.

episodes.name: Pane in the Glass
episodes.description: The MythBusters take on an incredibly dangerous, glass-shattering movie myth, and they search for a no-cry kitchen cure for chopping onions.

episodes.name: Rock 'n' Roll Road Rage
episodes.description: The MythBusters investigate if a leaping carp could land a killer blow to a water skier. Then they turn up the volume and test if listening to aggressive music leads to more aggressive driving.

episodes.name: Earthquake Water Heater
episodes.description: The MythBusters investigate if a water-heater can turn into a destructive torpedo, and they reveal the explosive power of flatulence.

episodes.name: Christmas Special
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie count down the top ten stories voted on by viewers while busting holiday myths. They find out if putting a silver spoon in champagne keeps it fizzy and if a snowman melts faster with clothes on or off.

episodes.name: Ultimate MythBusters
episodes.description: Adam and Jamie reflect on past successes and tackle new challenges as they compete to find out who is the ultimate MythBuster. The abilities to overcome fear and withstand pain are high on the list of required skills.

episodes.name: Buster Special
episodes.description: The dummy Buster's greatest moments and biggest sacrifices are revisited before he gets rebuilt. He's taken more than a dummy can bear, from his fateful trip in the elevator of death to the bridge jump that claimed his last limbs.
